body:
Netflix, Inc. has received $0.37 as the consensus Earnings Estimate for the Quarter ending on Mar 2017 ,According to the estimate provided by 13 Financial Advisor in the Stock Trading Firms. Among 13 Analysts, Bottom line EPS Estimate for the current quarter is $0.31 while the top line estimate is $0.39 , a key information to consider for Day Trading and investing in stocks. The EPS growth rate is projected at 515.38%.

Netflix, Inc. reported better than expected with a surprise EPS of 15.38% or $0.02 during its most recent quarterly earnings. The Actual EPS was $0.15 compared to the Estimated EPS of $0.13. Los Gatos based Netflix, Inc. Last reported the Quarter results on Dec 31, 2016 and the Next earnings date is scheduled to be released on Apr 17, 2017.

Netflix, Inc. has a Price to Earnings ratio of 336.24 for the trailing twelve month period. The price to book ratio of the company for the most recent quarter is 22.61. For the Most Recent Fiscal Year, Netflix, Inc. has a price to cash ratio of 11.86. For the Trailing twelve month period, company showed a Net Profit Margin of 2.11% and Return on Equity of the stock is 7.51%.

In the last quarter, Netflix, Inc. reported Annual Earnings of $0.15. Based on the filings, last years Annual Earnings was, $0.43. In the last Quarter, NFLX reported a surprise Earnings per Share of 15.38% . The consensus estimate for current quarter is $0.37 and for the current fiscal year, the estimate is $1.07. For the Next fiscal year, the estimate is $2.1 based on the consensus.

Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) stock ended Tuesday session in the red zone in a volatile trading. The stock closed down 0.51 points or 0.36% at $140.71 with 4,411,631 shares getting traded. Post opening the session at $140.55, the shares hit an intraday low of $139.7 and an intraday high of $141.83 and the price was in this range throughout the day. The company has a market cap of $60,563 million and the number of outstanding shares has been calculated to be 430,411,590 shares. The 52-week high of Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) is $143.46 and the 52-week low is $79.95.

Netflix is the worlds leading Internet television network with millions of subscribers in nearly 50 countries who have access to an ever-expanding library of TV shows and movies, including original programming, documentaries and feature films. The company offers the ability to watch as subscribers want, anytime, anywhere, on nearly any Internet-connected screen.
